titles.title: RS436 Dear Lord, to you again our gifts we bring,

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Dear Lord, to you again our gifts we bring,
this bread our toil, this wine our ecstasy,
poor and imperfect though they both must be;
yet you will take a heart-free offering.
Yours is the bounty, ours the unfettered will
to make or mar, to fashion good or ill.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Yes, you will take and bless, and grace impart
to make again what once your goodness gave,
what we half crave, and half refuse to have,
a sturdier will, a more repentant heart.
You have on earth no hands, no heart but ours;
bless them as yours, ourselves, our will, our powers.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Break bread, O Lord, break down our wayward wills,
break down our prized possessions, break them down;
let them be feely given as your own
to all who need our gifts, to heal their ills.
Break this, the bread we bring, that all may share
in your one living body, everywhere.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Our lips receive your wine, our hands the bread;
you give us back the selves we offered you,
won by the Cross, by Calvary made new,
a heart enriched, a life raised from the dead.
Grant us to take and guard your treasure well,
that we in you, and you in us may dwell.
